Title: Game Data Analyst (World of Tanks)
Description:
Job Overview




Wargaming is looking for a proactive, excited, and determined Game Data Analyst to strengthen the World of Tanks product analytics team.

We collect all kinds of information about the player's behavior and the events in the ‘WoT universe’: from economic, financial, and detailed combat data to the precise coordinates of each shot and tank movement, interface telemetry, and many others. All of them are routed to a singular database and are available for analysis 24/7.

You will be working with the WoT Product Team responsible for decision-making process, with the Data Warehouse team responsible for data storage, reports system and our infrastructure, as well as 60 analytics all over the world united under Wargaming Global Analyst Network.




What will you do?




Helping deliver important analytical insights to managers and other product teams necessary for decision-making.
Use quantitative analysis to understand how the game is played and identify impact and growth opportunities.
Participating in analytical maintenance for features, game events, and modes throughout all development and release stages:
Pre-Production Analytics: modeling likely outcomes and risks from implementing new features, game modes, and events into the game; predict the future events, product KPIs and metrics; providing analysis of their full development cycle (from concept to release);
Production Analytics: developing and preparing analytical reports, metrics and methodologies for evaluating features, game modes, and events in operation; looking for anomalies and insights that help increase effectiveness of the product and its parts;
Operation Analytics: creating and supporting analytical tools and interfaces (dashboards) for rapid updates on the status of the product and its subsystems delivered to the management and the responsible teams.
Gather and formulate requirements, conduct analytical research from producers, PMs, UX/UI and game designers, developers, QA and artists.
Presenting the research results and filling the product analytics knowledge base to share with other teams.







What are we looking for?




3+ years experience in a similar position.
Understanding the principles of formalizing business tasks in research plans, as well as experience writing analytical reports and presenting their results.
Advanced SQL knowledge.
Experience with at least one data visualization solution (Tableau / Qlik / Microsoft Power BI, etc).
Experience with Python/R and popular libraries for data processing and analysis.
Great communication skills, both written and spoken, especially for a non-technical audience.
Written and spoken English (B1 and higher).







What additional skills will help you stand out?




Being prepared to learn, take in, and systemize vast amounts of data within a short time.
Experience working with Cloudera Impala / Hive, Oracle SQL, Snowflake.
Knowledge and practical application of machine learning algorithms.
Rich gaming experience in different games and over 1000 World of Tanks battles.




Benefits

Benefits and perks are tailored to the local market and culture. Our benefits in Berlin include:

Career development and education opportunities within the company
Home internet reimbursement
Gym membership through Urban Sports Club - Package M
Mental well-being program (iFeel)
Language classes
Company pension scheme with a company contribution up to 150 EUR per month
Personal Gaming Account
Coffee, fruits, and snacks in the office
Company events
Seniority Awards
Referral program - You can recommend the best talents to the company and receive a reward
Show more
HTML:
Job Overview


Wargaming is looking for a proactive, excited, and determined Game Data Analyst to strengthen the World of Tanks product analytics team.

We collect all kinds of information about the player's behavior and the events in the ‘WoT universe’: from economic, financial, and detailed combat data to the precise coordinates of each shot and tank movement, interface telemetry, and many others. All of them are routed to a singular database and are available for analysis 24/7.

You will be working with the WoT Product Team responsible for decision-making process, with the Data Warehouse team responsible for data storage, reports system and our infrastructure, as well as 60 analytics all over the world united under Wargaming Global Analyst Network.


What will you do?


  • Helping deliver important analytical insights to managers and other product teams necessary for decision-making.
  • Use quantitative analysis to understand how the game is played and identify impact and growth opportunities.
  • Participating in analytical maintenance for features, game events, and modes throughout all development and release stages:
  • Pre-Production Analytics: modeling likely outcomes and risks from implementing new features, game modes, and events into the game; predict the future events, product KPIs and metrics; providing analysis of their full development cycle (from concept to release);
  • Production Analytics: developing and preparing analytical reports, metrics and methodologies for evaluating features, game modes, and events in operation; looking for anomalies and insights that help increase effectiveness of the product and its parts;
  • Operation Analytics: creating and supporting analytical tools and interfaces (dashboards) for rapid updates on the status of the product and its subsystems delivered to the management and the responsible teams.
  • Gather and formulate requirements, conduct analytical research from producers, PMs, UX/UI and game designers, developers, QA and artists.
  • Presenting the research results and filling the product analytics knowledge base to share with other teams.



What are we looking for?


  • 3+ years experience in a similar position.
  • Understanding the principles of formalizing business tasks in research plans, as well as experience writing analytical reports and presenting their results.
  • Advanced SQL knowledge.
  • Experience with at least one data visualization solution (Tableau / Qlik / Microsoft Power BI, etc).
  • Experience with Python/R and popular libraries for data processing and analysis.
  • Great communication skills, both written and spoken, especially for a non-technical audience.
  • Written and spoken English (B1 and higher).



What additional skills will help you stand out?


  • Being prepared to learn, take in, and systemize vast amounts of data within a short time.
  • Experience working with Cloudera Impala / Hive, Oracle SQL, Snowflake.
  • Knowledge and practical application of machine learning algorithms.
  • Rich gaming experience in different games and over 1000 World of Tanks battles.


Benefits

Benefits and perks are tailored to the local market and culture. Our benefits in Berlin include:

  • Career development and education opportunities within the company
  • Home internet reimbursement
  • Gym membership through Urban Sports Club - Package M
  • Mental well-being program (iFeel)
  • Language classes
  • Company pension scheme with a company contribution up to 150 EUR per month
  • Personal Gaming Account
  • Coffee, fruits, and snacks in the office
  • Company events
  • Seniority Awards
  • Referral program - You can recommend the best talents to the company and receive a reward

Title: Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
For our headquarters in Berlin Prenzlauer-Berg, we are looking to have you on-board as our new:

Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)




Our Data Platform team enables data-driven decision-making at home24 and our partners by developing impactful data products with end-to-end responsibility from data integration to dashboards and data science applications. As part of our growing team, you'll work on an exciting new project, making it an ideal time to welcome you to our team.




Your Responsibilities

Collaborate with your team members to design, implement and maintain data processing pipelines in different clouds (AWS and Azure)
Assist in defining the vision and objectives for data products by working closely with product managers, analysts, and other team members
Support analysts in developing high-performing and insightful dashboards by providing necessary data infrastructure
Implement automated monitoring tools to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Engage proactively with cross-functional teams to identify and implement pragmatic solutions to business problems
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering processes and best practices




Your Profile

If you're interested in the role, but don't meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We value a willingness to learn and grow with us. Tell us why you’re the right person in your application.

University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related area
First experience working on projects using Python or Scala with data processing frameworks
Understanding of SQL
A passion for emerging technologies
Understanding of data modeling concepts
Experience with the AWS or Azure clouds
Experience in e-commerce is a plus




What We Offer You

Your impact

The chance to make an impact in a highly motivated team of professionals
An open-minded culture ready to incorporate new and creative ideas

Your growth

Mentoring and support from experienced colleagues
Extensive learning opportunities from our home24 academy and external partners
Room for growth and development within your role through regular feedback rounds

Your path

Hybrid working model: you have the flexibility to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays in our standard working mode. We are in the office together Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays
The possibility to work up to two months per year within Germany or from an EU country
Up to 30 days paid vacation each year to unwind and recharge
City mobility with a subsidized public transportation ticket and our eco-friendly bike leasing program #ridinghome

Your second home

International campus in the heart of Berlin featuring drive-in bicycle garage, outdoor space and lounge areas, fitness facilities, parent and multi-faith rooms close to the Berlin S-Bahn train station Landsberger Allee
Company benefits including a pension scheme, 30 % off the home24 assortment, and employee discounts at partner organizations
You want to learn more about our home24 company culture and what it is like to be a homie? Follow @teamhome24 on Instagram




If you want to become part of a thrilling success story – we are looking forward to your application. Please send us your resume, cover letter and all relevant documents together with your salary expectations and the earliest possible starting date via our career site.




Your home is surely filled with furniture of varying materials and styles. The same is true for home24 as an employer. We celebrate the diversity of the people who work with us. Be who you are and feel welcome to #makeyourselfathome24




You can find all job offers on our career site !




home24 SE | Otto-Ostrowski-Straße 3 | 10249 Berlin | Contact: Nadine Scharf

Show more

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are seeking an organised and self-motivated Data Analyst to work embedded in our Marketing Data team, one of our cross-functional Data teams to help shape the development of one of the world's leading FinTech products.

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Marketing team to make data-driven decisions. You will monitor, measure and analyse the effectiveness of your marketing teams’ initiatives, as well as help drive the strategy of your stakeholder teams. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, scientists and marketing managers.

In This Role, You Will


Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable targets based on an initiatives’ scope.
Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Driving end to end high complexity analysis on a strategic level in which the business domain is critical to drive overall company success.
Stakeholder management: Be an internal go-to-person for your teams when it comes to data related questions.
Evaluate initiatives: Support Marketing experimentation & testing initiatives; design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights. Share these learnings through clear documentation and concise and empathic communication.
Contribute to self-serve data platform: Help building the right analytics foundations ,by pairing up with technical peers, so our marketing teams can interact with data and extract the right insights themselves.
Provide monitoring tools: Build the dashboards your team looks at every week to make sure they are impacting our company OKRs.
Improve data literacy of organisation: Educate teams to become independent when it comes to data access and understanding function led training and team wide workshops to foster data driven culture.
Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.


What You Need To Be Successful


5+ years of experience, within the Marketing or Product Analytics field.
Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)Good presentation skills and communication skills.
Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like lifecycle, marketing strategy, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
Experience with Customer Data Platforms (eg. Braze, Treasure Data) would be a plus.
Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
Having experience in fintech would be a plus.


What’s In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe’s most talked about disruptors 🚀.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Vacation days vary depending on your location of work. Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today’s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it’s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

Founded in 2013, N26 now has more than 8 million customers in 24 markets. We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
GETEC ist einer der führenden Energieversorger und Contracting-Spezialisten für Industrie und Immobilienwirtschaft in Europa. Unser Werteversprechen "Wir haben die Energie für mehr" ist Leitbild für über 2.400 Mitarbeiter, die mit exzellentem Engineering-Know-how, herausragender regulatorischer Kompetenz, ausgewiesener Handlungsschnelligkeit und umfassender Nachhaltigkeitsexpertise unsere Kunden durch eine immer komplexer werdende Energiewelt navigieren.

Deine zukünftige Aufgabe

Wir vertrauen auf Deine Expertise, wenn es um die Lieferantenqualifizierung und -verwaltung innerhalb der internen Systeme geht.
Die systemübergreifende Analyse und Weiterentwicklung der Datenlandschaft, um Datenverfügbarkeit und Transparenz zu gewährleisten (PLM, ERP) gehören ebenfalls zu Deinen Aufgaben.
Du erstellst Datenbanken und entwirfst Visualisierungen, die es dem Projektteam ermöglichen, mit fortschrittlichen Analysetools (PowerBI) zu arbeiten.
Um Reibungen und Potenziale zu verstehen, schlägst Du im engen Kontakt mit Prozess- und Methodenexperten KI-Anwendungen innerhalb des GETEC-Einkaufs vor und treibst die Nutzung von KI an.
Du bist für die Aufrechterhaltung und Überprüfung der Datenqualität, Harmonisierung und Konsolidierung zuständig.
Das Durchführen von Schulungen und Demos für PowerBI und vergleichbare Tools rundet Dein Aufgabengebiet ab.


Du als Mensch und was Du mitbringst

Bachelor-Abschluss mit Schwerpunkt Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einen vergleichbaren Studiengang
Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse von großen Daten und Simulationen
Vorerfahrung im Einkauf, der Versicherungsbranche oder dem Bankwesen von Vorteil
Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse in PowerBI, MS Office und verschiedenen ERP-Systemen
Ausgeprägte analytische und methodische Fähigkeiten sowie hohes Maß an Genauigkeit und Qualität
Strukturierte Arbeitsmethoden und hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und proaktiver Arbeitsweise
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse zwingend erforderlich


Wir bieten MEHR

Du hast bei uns die Möglichkeit, die Energiewende aktiv mitzugestalten.
Ab Tag Eins bist Du Teil des Teams und hast die Chance direkt Verantwortung zu übernehmen.
Wir ermöglichen Dir eine gute Work-Life-Balance durch eine flexible Arbeitszeitplanung mit Gleitzeit sowie 30 Urlaubstagen im Jahr.
Wir bieten unseren Mitarbeitern das Jobrad-Konzept: 365 Tage im Jahr fit halten und zusätzlich die Umwelt schonen.
Freue Dich auf die Nutzung zahlreicher Fitness- und Wellness-Angebote bei einer Mitgliedschaft über unseren Kooperationspartner Hansefit.
Du möchtest Dich weiterentwickeln? Nutze deinen kostenlosen Zugang zu LinkedIn Learning und bekomme Zugriff auf unzählige Trainings- und Lernvideos. Zudem bieten wir eine Vielzahl von internen und externen Weiterbildungs- und Coaching-Angeboten an.
Die Atmosphäre ist Dir wichtig? – Agiles Arbeiten und moderne Bürokonzepte sind für uns eine Selbstverständlichkeit.
Durch unser Corporate Benefit Portal erhältst Du Zugang zu verschiedenen Vergünstigungen bei über 800 namhaften Produkt- und Eventanbietern.


Wir laden alle Menschen herzlich dazu ein, Teil der GETEC-Familie zu werden und unsere offene und wertschätzende Unternehmenskultur zu erleben. Wir sind überzeugt, dass jeder Einzelne von uns einen Beitrag zur Energiewende leisten kann. Es spielt dabei keine Rolle, woher Du kommst, welches Geschlecht oder welche sexuelle Orientierung Du hast, welchem Glauben Du angehörst oder ob Du Einschränkungen hast.
Das GETEC Recruiting Team freut sich auf Deine Kontaktaufnahme und Deine Bewerbung:
MAKING A DIFFERENCE FOR GENERATIONS TO COME.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Business Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Business Analytics and will see you collaborate primarily with the Supply Tech Team to improve supplier engagement and, in turn increase the inventory available on the marketplace for our travellers

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience working in Marketplace business
Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity.
Experience in statistical modelling.
Experience in B2B product analytics.


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
Show more

Who You Are

  • 5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
  • Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
  • Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
  • Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
  • Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice to have

  • Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
  • Experience working in Marketplace business
  • Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity.
  • Experience in statistical modelling.
  • Experience in B2B product analytics.

How We Set You Up For Success

  • Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
  • Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
  • Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
  • Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
  • Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies

And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
About the Job

We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d) to join our portfolio company in the heart of Berlin.

In your day-to-day work, you'll focus on defining and executing the data model and strategy analysis, take the lead in tool and system innovations, and contribute to various projects.

Join our portfolio company: Founded in 2021 with its HQ in Berlin/Germany, the company runs a trailblazing marketplace that redefines one of the largest supply chains on earth. The company's mission is to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing global access to high-quality products through its innovative platform. Since its launch in January 2022, the firm has operated discreetly with no public profile or media coverage while it has already successfully served hundreds of companies.

In this role, you'll:


Lead the development and maintenance of the company's BI structure to support strategic business initiatives
Conduct complex data analysis to extract deep insights and trends that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Create advanced dashboards, reports, and visualizations that facilitate data-driven decision-making at all levels of the organization
Act as a strategic partner to senior management and department heads, understanding their data needs and delivering actionable intelligence
Facilitate data-driven discussions and workshops with stakeholders to enhance organizational data literacy
Develop and implement comprehensive data validation and cleansing processes to maintain the highest data quality standards
Lead the continuous improvement and optimization of the BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities using advanced BI tools and platforms (such as Tableau, Power BI, SQL, and Databricks)
Mentor and develop junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth within the team


Your Profile


Master's degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field. A master's degree is strongly preferred
5+ years of extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting
Proven track record of delivering strategic insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau/PowerBI, SQL, and Google Sheets
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks


Please note that we are looking for support in the Berlin office of our portfolio company. Eligibility to work within the EU is required as well.

Benefits and Perks


Fulfil a role with entrepreneurial freedom and take a pre-validated business model to the next level
Join an experienced founding team of serial and 2nd-time founders
Attractive base and bonus compensation program
Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts


Apply below and become a part of our success story!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Project A is committed to diverse and equal opportunities hiring for all – applicants, candidates, and employees alike. We value humans – with all our glorious multifaceted backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences – and look forward to your application.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Your mission

VisionAI is a fast-growing AI startup based in Berlin & London and we are at the forefront of reshaping online retail through innovative AI technologies. We're on a mission to level the playing field, providing intelligent tools that empower all online retailers with data-based decision-making capabilities, not just giants like Amazon. Our expert founding team comprises former online retailers and data scientists, who are committed to bringing e-commerce into the future, today.

About Our Mission

Every online retailer deserves access to the latest AI technologies, regardless of size or customer data. Our strong data and research background allows us to pioneer new methods in visual AI, expanding the application possibilities of these technologies.

Our tools help customers grow revenue, increase customer satisfaction and reduce the cost of operating all with the click of a button.

Join the Rebellion and become a vital part of VisionAI!

Role expectations: What you’ll be responsible for


Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines that support a wide range of data consumers, from internal teams focused on optimization to external platforms showcasing our platform's impact.
Collaborate closely with software engineers, AI researchers, and business stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver tailored, scalable data solutions.
Implement robust data warehousing solutions to ensure secure and efficient data storage and retrieval, supporting various analytical and operational needs.
Develop tools and systems to monitor, analyze, and improve data quality, ensuring that our data is reliable and accurate for all use cases.
Contribute to the expansion of our platform’s data-driven features, empowering customers with in-depth insights into their teams’ productivity and other key metrics.


Your profile

Your profile: What We Are Expecting From You In This Role


Demonstrated experience in data engineering, with a solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and system design.
Nice to have could be a degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar - however, we mainly care about your skills & experience in that field, not your degree
Proficiency in programming languages relevant to data engineering, such as Python, Scala, or Java.
Hands-on experience with big data tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g. Argo Workflows).
Proficiency in designing, implementing, and managing databases, including experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Neo4j).
A proactive approach to ensuring data quality and reliability, with a commitment to continuous improvement and innovation.


Why us?

As part of the VisionAI team, you will be looked after with some great benefits including:


Supportive Team: Be a key player in our engineering team and help achieve the next step towards our long term product vision. Collaborate with passionate and supportive colleagues, celebrating successes together and learning from challenges.
Diversity & Inclusion at Our Core: We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. At VisionAI, we believe that having diverse teams where everyone can bring their whole self to work is key to our success. We celebrate all backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.
Work-Life Balance: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements to support your personal and professional life: Whether it is flexible working hours or working from home when you need it. Oh and by the way: Longing for sunshine in the fall? Take advantage of a workation and work from a sunny location anywhere in europe.
Vibrant Office Space: Our office isn’t just a place to work—it’s a hub of activity and connection! Enjoy our team-space, daily lunches, our office gym, regular team-events and our vibrant office culture whenever you feel like it.
Professional Development: We are committed to your growth, offering ongoing training and development opportunities. You’ll have the chance to influence processes, learn new technologies, and advance your career.
Top-Notch Equipment: Receive a new MacBook, headphones and other essential tools to excel in your role.
Feel-Good Guarantee & Culture: We prioritize openness, fun, and community. Enjoy drinks, social events, and feel free to bring your dog to the office.


About Us

VisionAI is a fast-growing AI startup based in Bielefeld and London. We are leading online commerce into a new era with the help of AI technologies. We transform e-commerce with the help of intelligent tools and give our customers a competitive advantage through data-based decisions. We bring e-commerce stores into the AI age and enable online retailers to keep up with the giants around Amazon & Co.

About us: Our team consists of former e-commerce retailers and data scientists who are convinced that online retailers should have access to the latest AI technologies to make the store experience an exceptional one for their customers.

Through our strong research background, we are able to develop new methods in the field of visual AI and manage to expand the possibilities of these technologies and bring them into application.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d) - Building Nature's Data Pipelines
Description:
Our goal is for every company in Europe to invest in secure, transparent, and local nature projects through their green account!

We’re looking for a Data Engineer (m/f/d) with a focus on data pipelines and maps, who is ready to drive our mission of building Europe's leading nature trading platform to unlock nature restoration at scale.

We offer you the unique opportunity to work in a strong startup team of 10 people, and to collaborate with the CTO to build the tech foundation.

If you’re passionate about the environment and sustainability and want to be part of a future where investments in nature and biodiversity are transparent, standardized, and secure, then you're the perfect fit for us!

Tasks


Extract, transform, and refine data, often GIS related, to enhance our projects.
Establish the groundwork for our data pipelines and select the right tools with us.
Design models that bring up new insights, like forecasts of ecosystem services, hotspots, etc.
Bring data in shapes that serves maps, visualisations, frontends and integrations.
Collaborate with the full team with all relevant stake.



Requirements


Experience with Python, Postgres
Experiences with GIS tools, like PostGIS or QGIS (or willing to learn)
Able to setup basic data related DevOps work (deployment, monitoring) on your own
Willing to pick up topics, build things, experiment and refine
Regardless of your experience level, we’re looking for someone who’s eager to take the ownership to build our data pipeline setup.
German skills are a plus



Benefits


A meaningful role in a company that drives real, sustainable impact by recreating nature today.
Competitive salary.
A lot of freedom to shape your role, decision making and influence the company’s success.
Room to grow with the team into topics and roles.
Hybrid work environment, offices in Berlin and Bielefeld.
Regular team meetups, workshops to connect and collaborate.
Startup environment – but with traction, revenue and funding.
We have an extensive network not only in the biodiversity scene, but also to the key players, the landowners.



Are you ready to shape the future of natural capital markets? Join our team at green account and help us unlock the full potential of nature!
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.




We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.




Responsibilities




Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.




Required Skills




5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Desirable Skills




Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst / Data Engineer (f/m/x) – Trade Finance
Description:
Position Overview

Deutsche Bank Technology in Berlin

DB Technology is a global team of tech specialists, spread across multiple trading hubs and tech centres. We have a strong focus on promoting technical excellence – our engineers work at the forefront of financial services innovation using cutting-edge technologies.

Our Berlin location is our most recent addition to our global network of tech centres and growing strongly. We are committed to building a diverse workforce and to creating excellent opportunities for talented engineers and technologists. Our tech teams and business units use agile ways of working to create #GlobalHausbank solutions from our home market.

Trade Finance and Lending (TF&L) is one of the leading business departments in the Corporate Bank working with clients around the globe. It has great dependency on IT platform to service the Bank’s clients. The group is working on technology refresh of their IT platform to enable new services for customers as well as to achieve next level of business processes automation.

In-house IT team already achieved great success designing, building and rolling out into production its strategic platform for TF&L business. Based on that success there is a further desire to build towards our strategic architecture.

Your primary focus will be to develop the strategic data platform central to the tech transformation of one of the key revenue generating businesses in the Bank.


>You love this job but feel you cannot tick 100% of the boxes? Send us your CV anyway!



Your Key Responsibilities


Work closely with business stakeholders and product owner to define MIS solution roadmap and requirements
Design, build and maintain MIS dashboards and data feeds; consolidate multiple datasets into datamarts and metrics for the business users and the clients of the bank
Define and maintain org-level central data model for TF&L business, evolve it to support project goals but keep it consistent for the future
Partner with data engineering teams to align the data platform technical roadmap with MIS requirements
Support audit, regulatory requests and management teams with data investigations, deep dives and ad-hoc analysis



Your Skills And Experiences


Experience in data analysis and data interpretation, good hands-on SQL knowledge (ClickHouse is a plus), experience in BI Tools, e.g. Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker etc. Python is a plus.
Understanding of dashboard design and data visualisation principles
Business requirements analysis and management skills; relevant experience in the banking sector is a plus
Strong communication skills, stakeholder management, communication with groups of SMEs, making decisions in a group setting
Experience in data modelling, logical and physical data models, protocol formats; experience in modelling tools e.g. Legend, Power Designer is a plus
Knowledge of data architecture, data pipelines, ELT/ELT, data quality controls
Fluent written and spoken English – you will communicate a lot on your job as part of a global team



What we offer:

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.


Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.



Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

This job is available in full and parttime.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Kilian Weber.

Contact: Kilian Weber (+49(30)3407-3087)

Wir streben eine Unternehmenskultur an, in der wir gemeinsam jeden Tag das Beste geben. Dazu gehören verantwortungsvolles Handeln, wirtschaftliches Denken, Initiative ergreifen und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit.

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und fördern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.
Show more

  • Design, build and maintain MIS dashboards and data feeds; consolidate multiple datasets into datamarts and metrics for the business users and the clients of the bank
  • Define and maintain org-level central data model for TF&L business, evolve it to support project goals but keep it consistent for the future
  • Partner with data engineering teams to align the data platform technical roadmap with MIS requirements
  • Support audit, regulatory requests and management teams with data investigations, deep dives and ad-hoc analysis


Your Skills And Experiences

  • Experience in data analysis and data interpretation, good hands-on SQL knowledge (ClickHouse is a plus), experience in BI Tools, e.g. Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker etc. Python is a plus.
  • Understanding of dashboard design and data visualisation principles
  • Business requirements analysis and management skills; relevant experience in the banking sector is a plus
  • Strong communication skills, stakeholder management, communication with groups of SMEs, making decisions in a group setting
  • Experience in data modelling, logical and physical data models, protocol formats; experience in modelling tools e.g. Legend, Power Designer is a plus
  • Knowledge of data architecture, data pipelines, ELT/ELT, data quality controls
  • Fluent written and spoken English – you will communicate a lot on your job as part of a global team


What we offer:

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.

  • Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
  • Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
  • Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
  • Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.


Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

This job is available in full and parttime.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Kilian Weber.

Contact: Kilian Weber (+49(30)3407-3087)

Wir streben eine Unternehmenskultur an, in der wir gemeinsam jeden Tag das Beste geben. Dazu gehören verantwortungsvolles Handeln, wirtschaftliches Denken, Initiative ergreifen und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit.

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begrüßen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und fördern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.

Title: Data Analyst Insurance (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil des Verivox Teams!

Du fühlst Dich in der Welt der Daten zuhause und möchtest die Zukunft unserer Versicherungssparte aktiv mitgestalten? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig:

Für unseren Standort in Leipzig, Heidelberg, Berlin oder München suchen wir dich mit mehrtägiger Mobile Office Option pro Woche in Vollzeit (40 h) zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als Data Analyst Insurance (m/w/d)

Deine Mission


Du wendest deine gesammelten Erfahrungen im Bereich Mathematik/Statistik und Informatik in Kombination an
Mit explorativer Datenanalyse und Machine Learning Modellen beantwortest du Fragen der Stakeholder
Durch Analysen, Deepdives und in Reporten findest du Probleme, die den Weg zu neuen und wertvollen Lösungen ebenen können


Das bringst du mit


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes naturwissenschaftliches Studium, idealerweise mit Schwerpunkt Mathematik/Statistik und Informatik
Du besitzt mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Rolle und hast gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie mit relationalen Datenbanken
Du bringst Big-Data- und Machine-Learning-relevante Programmierkenntnisse (Python, Pandas, scipy, poetry, etc.) mit, Erfahrungen im Bereich der Datenvisualisierung sind von Vorteil
Du hast praktische Erfahrungen mit Git
Du verfügst über sehr gute deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse


Das bieten wir dir


Rund 500 Mitarbeiter aus über 35 Nationen als kollegiale Gemeinschaft
Offene und diverse Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien sowie modernem und wertschätzendem Arbeitsumfeld
Großzügige Mobile Office-Regelungen, die flexibles Arbeiten von zu Hause und aus dem EU-Ausland ermöglichen
Eigener Verantwortungsbereich mit Raum zur Entfaltung eigener Ideen und Konzepte
Unkompliziertes Miteinander: wir duzen uns & bestehen nicht auf Dresscodes
Exklusive Mitarbeitervorteile wie Jobticket, Jobrad, Zuschuss zum Mittagessen über Sodexo und Mitarbeiterrabatte
Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement, wie betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Urban Sportsclub und Mental Health Days
Zentral gelegene Offices in Heidelberg, Berlin, München und Leipzig mit optimaler Verkehrsanbindung


Abbinder

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann freuen wir uns, dich kennenzulernen. Überzeuge uns davon, dass du uns nach vorne bringst! Bitte sende deine Bewerbung inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung und Kündigungsfrist bzw. frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin über den Link "Jetzt Bewerben" oder an jobs[AT]verivox.com .

Verivox ist eines der führenden Online-Vergleichsportale in Deutschland. Seit 1998 machen wir Märkte in den Bereichen Strom & Gas, Mobilfunk & Internet sowie Finanzen & Versicherungen transparent. Aus rund 30.000 Tarifen finden wir das beste Angebot für Verbraucherinnen und Verbraucher und helfen so Haushalten, Zeit und Geld zu sparen. Mehr als 8 Millionen Menschen haben mit unserer Hilfe bereits über 2 Milliarden Euro gespart. Seit 2015 ist Verivox Teil der ProSiebenSat.1-Gruppe.

Unternehmenstext

Informiere dich hier über die ProSiebenSat.1 Group und unser vielseitiges Portfolio.

Du hast eine Behinderung und möchtest dich bewerben? Dann bist du bei uns herzlich willkommen.

Wir wissen, dass wir noch nicht gänzlich barrierefrei sind, aber wir arbeiten daran. Lass uns darüber reden, wie wir diese Barriere gemeinsam abschaffen und wenn nötig eine individuelle Lösung finden können.

Ausschließlich aus Gründen der besseren Lesbarkeit wird nur die männliche Form verwendet. Selbstverständlich sind immer alle Geschlechter angesprochen.

Das bieten wir dir: Training and Education Subsidized company pension plan Flexible Working Hours No dress code Team Events Open corporate culture Exclusive employee benefits / discounts


Hybrid Work

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. That’s why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

We are looking for a senior people data analyst to join our talented analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and data visualisation to support and influence key business initiatives. Your insights will directly contribute to optimising our operations and will help guide strategic decisions across the organisation.

Your new adventure:


Gather and analyze data from various P&C systems and sources, including HRIS, ATS, performance management tools, employee surveys, and external benchmarks
Identify current industry trends and patterns within People data to provide insights into areas such as recruitment, talent management, workforce demographics, turnover rates, performance metrics, and employee engagement and proactively identify opportunities to enhance the organization’s analytical capabilities
Develop and maintain key People metrics and dashboards to track progress and identify areas for improvement. Present findings and recommendations through clear and compelling data visualizations and presentations
Provide data-driven recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders to inform strategic decisions related to human resources and organizational development
Collaborate with P&C business partners and other stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions that optimize the employee experience and drive organizational success
Lead or participate in special projects and initiatives related to HR analytics, such as predictive modelling, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the HR analytics team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.


Does this sound like you?


4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
Flexible working hours as long as you’re there for your team members
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits you’d expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)


Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.


Show more

Title: Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM
Description:
Um unseren Kunden passgenaue Produkte und einen bestmöglichen Service anbieten zu können, ist die Analyse und Interpretation von Daten essentiell. Als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) im Bereich Clients bei Verti liegt Dein Fokus auf der Datenaufbereitung und -analyse unserer Bestandskundendaten. Ziel ist es, unsere Kunden noch zielgruppengerechter anzusprechen und dadurch stärker an uns zu binden. Die Interaktion und der lösungsorientierte Austausch im eigenen Team aber vor allem auch mit anderen datengetriebenen Unternehmensbereichen ist uns dabei besonders wichtig. Nutze die Möglichkeit, Deine Expertise erfolgreich einzubringen und Analysen zu erarbeiten, die Grundlage für richtungsweisende Entscheidungen bei Verti sein können. Werde Teil unseres dynamischen und multikulturellen Clients Bereichs.

Verti ist auf Wachstumskurs und sucht Dich zur Verstärkung als Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Teltow bei Berlin.

Standort: Teltow

Startdatum: nach Vereinbarung

Die Position ist in Vollzeit zu besetzen.

Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) CRM

Das erwartet Dich:


Extrahierung von Bestandskunden-Daten, Durchführung von komplexen Datenanalysen und Erarbeitung von Prognosemodellen zur Lösung datengetriebener Fragestellungen und zur Generierung von Customer Insights entlang der gesamten Customer Journey
Definition von Zielstellungen für die bestandserhalt- oder kundenwertfördernden Aktionen gemeinsam mit dem CRM-Team
Evaluierung der Erreichung der genannten Ziele im Erfolgsmonitoring
Aufbereitung von aussagekräftigen Dashboards zur kontinuierlichen Erfolgskontrolle und Überwachung der Entwicklung der relevanten Customer KPIs
Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen zur Förderung des Bestandserhalts oder der Kundenwerterhöhung und Kommunikation dieser im eigenen Team sowie an das Management
Schnittstelle zu anderen datenverarbeitenden Bereichen im Unternehmen wie dem Data Warehouse, Versicherungsmathematik oder Data & Analytics


Das bringst Du mit:


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit relevantem Schwerpunkt (Betriebswirtschaft, Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik etc.) oder eine abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung mit entsprechender Weiterbildung
Relevante Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data/ Customer Analytics
Idealerweise erste Berufserfahrung im versicherungsmathematischen Bereich, Erfahrungen im Umfeld der Kfz- und Sachversicherung
Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL-basierten Anwendungen und Statistiitkprogrammen, Sicherer Umgang mit den gängigen MS Office-Anwendungen
Sehr gutes analytisches Denkvermögen, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, selbstständige, ergebnisorientierte sowie proaktive Arbeitsweise
Fähigkeit, komplexe Fragestellungen klar und verständlich zu visualisieren und zu kommunizieren
Sicheres Auftreten, Durchsetzungsfähigkeit und gute Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Arbeitserlaubnis der Europäischen Union
Deutschkenntnisse Level C1, sehr gute Englischkenntnisse


Das bieten wir Dir:

Ein verlässlicher Partner in besonderen Zeiten: Wir bieten unseren Bewerberinnen und Bewerbern Verlässlichkeit und Perspektiven in der aktuellen Situation und stellen weiterhin ein. Dabei haben die Gesundheit und Sicherheit unserer Bewerberinnen und Bewerber sowie unserer Mitarbeitenden oberste Priorität. Wir nutzen im Bewerbungsprozess virtuelle Medien (bspw. Video-Interviews) und halten uns bei persönlichen Gesprächen an definierte Hygiene- und Abstandsregeln.

Lokal und Global: Bei uns kannst Du Dich je nach Aufgabengebiet in internationale Projekte einbringen und in internationalen Teams innerhalb des MAPFRE-Konzerns arbeiten.

Innovation und Expertise: Ein Umfeld, in dem innovative, digitale Ideen wie in einem Start-up vorangetrieben werden - mit der Expertise aus mehr als 25 Jahren Erfahrung in der Versicherungsbranche.

Vielfalt und Nachhaltigkeit: Als Unterzeichner der Charta der Vielfalt stehen wir für Diversität und Gerechtigkeit am Arbeitsplatz. Gender Pay Gap? Nicht bei Verti! Ebenso hat bei uns der verantwortungsvolle Umgang mit Ressourcen einen hohen Stellenwert. Aktuell fokussieren wir uns darauf bis 2024 klimaneutral zu werden.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Role

My client are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and infrastructure. This role requires a strong understanding of PostgreSQL databases and experience working with cloud platforms.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.

Optimize PostgreSQL databases for performance and scalability.

Develop and maintain SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Work with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.

Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.

Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.




Qualifications

Strong expertise in PostgreSQL, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and security.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) for data storage, compute resources, and services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Aurora, Athena).

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to manage complex projects and interact effectively with other teams.




Bonus Points

Interest in working on providing solutions to environmental sustainability.

Experience with database change management systems like Liquibase, Flyway etc

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).

Experience with data warehousing concepts (e.g., dimensional modelling, slowly changing dimensions etc).

Certifications in cloud platforms or data engineering tools (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer).

Show more
HTML:
The Role

My client are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and infrastructure. This role requires a strong understanding of PostgreSQL databases and experience working with cloud platforms.


Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.

Optimize PostgreSQL databases for performance and scalability.

Develop and maintain SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Work with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.

Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.

Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.


Qualifications

Strong expertise in PostgreSQL, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and security.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) for data storage, compute resources, and services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Aurora, Athena).

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to manage complex projects and interact effectively with other teams.


Bonus Points

Interest in working on providing solutions to environmental sustainability.

Experience with database change management systems like Liquibase, Flyway etc

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).

Experience with data warehousing concepts (e.g., dimensional modelling, slowly changing dimensions etc).

Certifications in cloud platforms or data engineering tools (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer).

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search)
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime value…)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Previous experience in marketing attribution and paid search.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Lead, Data & Analytics Analyst (Zendesk AI Agents)
Description:
Job Description

Please note, to be eligible for this role you must be based in Berlin and hold the right to work in Germany.

This role will work on the exciting Zendesk AI Agent (Ultimate) product.

Ultimate were acquired by Zendesk in March 2024, we’ve become even more powerful.

Together with Zendesk we’re joining forces to build the world’s most advanced AI agents in CX.

The Role

We are looking for a Lead Data Analyst for our Analytics Core team here at Zendesk AI Agents.

This role in our newly created team will play a crucial role to build the foundation for future analytics and insight capabilities for our product. You will play a crucial role in identifying new ways to measure performance and key drivers, specifically in the context of generative bots, and enabling customers to continuously enhance the automation experience.

Additionally, you will work with Data Analysts and Data Engineers to define data requirements for our analytics platform and assist product squads in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy.

Key Responsibilities

Advanced Analytics & Modelling:


Building analytical solutions to support strategic product initiatives.
Partner with product manager to identify product opportunities to apply advanced analytics to validate data product ideas.
Collaborate with the product leadership and other stakeholders to develop actionable dashboards to measure product performance.


Strategic Data Leadership


Collaborate with leadership and engineering teams to define the long-term data and analytics strategy, aligning it with business goals.
Champion data-driven decision making across the organization.


Data Architecture & Infrastructure


Work with data engineers to define data models and data requirements and ensure efficient data pipelines.


Collaboration & Knowledge Transfer


Collaborate with Analysts from various teams across the organization to facilitate effective communication and knowledge sharing between Data Science and Data Analysis functions.
Mentor and support data analysts in their professional development, particularly in areas of advanced analytics and data modelling.


This role requires a strong blend of technical expertise and business acumen. You'll be an effective communicator who can bridge the gap between product , analytics, data science and engineering teams.

The ideal candidate for this role will have a deep understanding of the following:

Technical Skills


Working with large datasets and databases using SQL: Proficiency in data cleaning, transformation, and preparation for analytics.
Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python (or similar) for data manipulation and analysis.
Machine Learning & Statistics: Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and their practical implementations.
Data Modeling & Management: Expertise in relational and non-relational databases, data modeling techniques, understanding of dbt and data quality management practices.
Data Architecture & Infrastructure: Understanding of data warehousing, data lakes, big data technologies.
You have a Master’s degree in computer science, machine learning, statistics, engineering, mathematics or a related field.


Non-Technical Skills


Communication & Collaboration: Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with data analysts, engineers, and business stakeholders. Ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations.
Leadership & Mentorship: Strong leadership skills to guide data governance implementation and mentor data analysts in their professional development.
Data Governance & Compliance: Knowledge of data governance frameworks (e.g., Data Management Body of Knowledge - DAMA) and relevant data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).


How we measure success for this role, involves but not limited to:


Increased adoption of data-driven decision making within the R&D teams.
Increase in data quality metrics (accuracy, completeness, consistency).
Positive feedback from stakeholders on the data scientist's leadership and contributions.


The Interview Process

We want to be transparent about what you can expect from our interview process.


Initial Call with Talent Team - 15 mins
Hiring Manager Interview - 45 mins
Take Home Challenge
Technical Interview - 1 hour
Final interview with Leadership - 30 mins


Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love.

Zendesk believes in offering our people a fulfilling and inclusive experience. Our hybrid way of working, enables us to purposefully come together in person, at one of our many Zendesk offices around the world, to connect, collaborate and learn whilst also giving our people the flexibility to work remotely for part of the week.

The Intelligent Heart Of Customer Experience

Zendesk software was built to bring a sense of calm to the chaotic world of customer service. Today we power billions of conversations with brands you know and love. We advocate for digital first customer experiences—and we stick with it in our workplace. Over 5,000 employees worldwide are collaborating from kitchen tables, home offices, coworking spaces, and Zendesk workspaces to make one team.

Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.

Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to peopleandplaces@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.
