Title: Junior Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Recently acquired by Believe, Sentric Music is in an exciting phase of significant growth into new markets. Sentric Music Group is a rapidly expanding music publishing company with 100+ employees based across our offices in Liverpool, London, Hamburg, Palma, New York and LA. The company handles copyright and royalty administration for a large client base consisting of songwriters, record labels and music catalogue owners. Our industry-challenging platform is transforming the traditional models for royalty collection and our client base is consistently growing.

Believe is above all a passion for music, tech, and digital marketing, shared by over 2,200 talented people in more than 50 countries. It is a visionary and entrepreneurial spirit that drives us and makes us a world leader in the digital distribution of music.

Believe is a tribe of experts who successfully meet the challenges of the transformation of our music industry every day. It’s an adventure, a human adventure, and one that is propitious and stimulating for all of us.

Finally, Believe is a story that began in 2005 and that we must continue to narrate, now, and with you. Believe's mission is to develop labels and artists in the most suitable way, at each stage of their career and development, in all local markets around the world, with respect, expertise, fairness and transparency.

Job Description

The Insights Team lead on the continuous development and innovation of data resources and analytical capabilities, as well as establishing a working knowledge base for the wider business to ensure a single point of access to key information at every level of operation.

Job Summary

Reporting into the Product Insights Manager/Senior Insights Analyst, the Insights Analyst will work within the Insights team to provide the business with data and insights on clients, suppliers and internal activity to shape services and strategy and support continuous improvement across the business.

This role is critical to the delivery and development of our research and insights internally, and externally, and in supporting our commercial offering, competitive positioning, and business strategy.

Job Description


Conduct ad hoc data and analytics tasks in line ; ensuring stakeholders are kept informed on the progress and any risks and issues clearly communicated.
Support project lead on select Insights projects particularly focused around supporting operational excellence and sales enablement strategy.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of a suite of enterprise reports and dashboards to improve availability and transparency of information across the business.
Collaborate with the wider team to translate business problems and strategic requirements into actionable Insights objectives.
Support Product Insights efforts through providing data and analysis on product performance and user experience to inform product development processes.
Strive for maximum automation, standardisation and utilisation of reporting and insights in an easily digestible format.


Qualifications


Proven experience in data analysis
Knowledge and interest of the music publishing industry.
Keen eye for detail
Results orientated.
Proven technical and problem solving skills.
The ability to present complex ideas in a clear and engaging manner.
Ability to work across multiple projects and deliver to deadlines.
Experience querying and extracting using SQL
Knowledge of BI solutions and data visualisation tools (PowerBI/Tableau/Looker)
Familiarity with Python or similar programming language would be desirable.


Must have the right to work in the UK, otherwise, the application will not be considered.

Additional Information


Hybrid remote working policy
Private Health Care
Pension plan
25 days annual leave, + 1 day for your birthday
Life assurance and long-term disability cover  
Access a digital mental health and well-being platform
Tailor-made training and coaching program
Enhanced sickness pay and maternity/paternity cover


Must have the right to work in the UK, otherwise, the application will not be considered.

We are committed to having a workforce that is representative of the community it serves at all levels of the organisation. We, therefore, welcome applications from all backgrounds and all sections of the community regardless of age, disability, gender, race, religion and sexual orientation.

  • Life assurance and long-term disability cover  
  • Access a digital mental health and well-being platform

  • Enhanced sickness pay and maternity/paternity cover

We are committed to having a workforce that is representative of the community it serves at all levels of the organisation. We, therefore, welcome applications from all backgrounds and all sections of the community regardless of age, disability, gender, race, religion and sexual orientation.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

Provide state of the art operational data expertise to support investment teams and build strong connections with business stakeholders.

Secure daily data production tasks; delivering work of high quality. Daily tasks are structured into 3 groups forming the rota and you will be exposed to all shifts over time. Responsibilities include loading datasets, verifying overnight batches, checking the quality of accruals etc. These are designed to ensure data quality and consistency across systems.

Manage instruments and portfolios data exceptions to secure core investment data (securities statics, classifiers, pricing, analytics, valuations and P&L) as part of the day to day production:

Set up securities accurately and quickly as per the fund manager or traders' request so orders can be placed for trading; manage any exceptions when required.

Resolve issues/exceptions in a timely manner and escalate to management as required.

Actively provide updates to other team members, as well as internal stakeholders.

Perform daily data quality checks on Securities.

Continually improve and develop procedures/processes as the business advances by presenting findings and recommendations to the team.

Participate in the implementation of data management processes and the rollout of our Enterprise Data Management (EDM) solution within an agile framework.

Active involvement in Data and transversal Operations projects. Engage with stakeholders to understand and frame business issues, investigate and communicate findings and solutions to management.

Pro-actively collaborate with the Data team based in Singapore and manage the daily handover.

Skills:

Undergraduate degree in either Finance or Sciences.

Minimum 2-3 years' experience in a similar role within asset management, investment banking or financial vendors.

Strong knowledge of securities static data. An understanding of pricing, analytics and portfolio valuation is beneficial (ETD, OTC, Alternative Assets).

Good knowledge of investment operations systems and data providers, i.e. Bloomberg, Markit, Simcorp, Charles River, NeoXam. Knowledge of JIRA and Tableau beneficial.

Good communication skills, culture of service excellence, and a solution-oriented team player, you will be comfortable adapting to a shift/rota pattern.

Ability to establish and develop effective business engagement relationships with transversal stakeholders.

You will be self-motivated, curious, and detail-oriented. You will have a proactive approach to problem solving as well as being disciplined, rigorous and forward thinking with a flexible attitude and business-oriented sense of priorities.

Title: Data Analyst (Entry Level)
Description:
Are you looking to kickstart your career in data?

Join iO-Sphere's Data Analyst Experience Accelerator to land a job as a data analyst at a leading organisation!

Apply now to join our upcoming cohorts starting October 7th or November 18th: https://data-analytics.io-sphere.io/

Why choose iO-Sphere?

We run a unique training programme - the Data Analyst Experience Accelerator - that is designed to secure individuals their next career step and become a data analyst. Instead of a traditional classroom, you’ll be part of the new data team at our fictional e-commerce company, "Prism." From day one, you'll build the experience that leading employers require while learning the technical (Excel, SQL, Power BI, Python), professional, and business skills that are needed for a career in data. You will be delivering real projects using our data warehouse, which has over 500+ million rows of real data. We work with leading organisations looking to hire data analysts and match them with the best talent we have in our programs. We recruit our best students on behalf of our partner employers and use our training programmes to identity and up-skill people for their roles.

How does it work?


We work with our network of employers to understand their data talent needs. They are often looking for data analysts, senior analysts, data scientists, analytics engineers and effective managers
We recruit and train talented individuals over the course of 10 weeks to get them ready for the jobs with our employers
We match and connect our best students with our employers
Joining iO-Sphere means becoming part of the community for life. We continue to support our community with ongoing mentoring and training throughout their career


Ready to apply? It only takes a minute: https://data-analytics.io-sphere.io/

The Roles

We work with many different organisations seeking to hire talented data analysts. The majority of these roles will require you to:


Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using technical tools like Excel, SQL, Power BI, and Python
Create dashboards, presentations, and recommendations to help solve complex business problems
Work with management to prioritise business and information needs
Generate strong insights about the business to be able to improve performance


Ideal Candidates


Highly numerate & analytical thinker
Curious problem solver
Humble and willing to learn
The ability to commit to full time for 10 weeks
Fluent in written and spoken English


What To Expect On The Experience Accelerator


The Experience Accelerator is a flexible 10-week programme to give talented data professionals the technical skills and experience to take their career to the next level. By the end, you will be an effective data analyst with the toolkit to land the job you want
The first 5 weeks are full-time and fully remote
The final 5 weeks are full-time and remote


Ready to apply?

Step 1: Complete the 1-minute application form: https://data-analytics.io-sphere.io/

Step 2: Proceed with the remaining steps of the application process

Step 3: Commence your journey with us on October 7th or November 18th, 2024!

We strongly encourage applications from women, people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and non-binary individuals, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to equal opportunities and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to participate in our program. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage of the application or interview process, please inform us.

Title: Analyst - Performance & Insights
Description:
At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.

Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.

Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.

About The Opportunity

eBay Motors is a multi-billion dollar, global portfolio comprising the Parts & Accessories, Business & Industrial, Vehicles, and WHI (a B2B Parts & Accessories marketplace in US) businesses. These categories are not only among the largest on eBay and core to eBay’s strategic future, but also are actively innovating in the market and at eBay!

We are looking to hire an expert analyst, who will support the eBay UK’s Parts & Accessories leadership team and play an instrumental role in accelerating growth for P&A’s UK business. The role will utilise data and business case development to develop strategic insights, while ensuring operational excellence in planning, analytics, reporting, and teamwork across a broad cross-functional team. Our key partners include product, marketing, analytics, finance, operations, monetization, and business development, among many others.

The role demands a dual mentality: both that of a strategic leader—who has a deep understanding of the dynamics of two-sided marketplaces, can break down tough problems into clear frameworks, operate in ambiguity, and possesses strong data intuition—as well as someone who can move quickly and decisively as an embedded operator not afraid to get their hands dirty.

What you will accomplish


Serve as an analytics partner to the UK Parts & Accessories leadership team
Apply strategic, operational, and analytical standard methodologies to extract and present actionable insights on what’s driving business performance
Build and develop key performance indicators and dashboards to track business performance. Responsible for monitoring metrics, identifying and understanding root causes behind the metrics movement, and synthesizing insights to communicate these insights to senior colleagues
Identify and execute against opportunities across the Parts & Accessories landscape that require strategic deep dives
Partner with Category Managers, partners, and sellers to drive key initiatives



What You Will Bring


Strategic problem solver with strong analytical/data science skills to dive into data and identity root causes
High degree of ownership and commitment to results
Self-motivated to find opportunities and challenges in the business
Communicates clearly, effectively, and proactively with strong listening, written, and verbal communication skills
Ambition to grow professionally and willingness to work hard, learn/adapt, and provide feedback both upward and to peer teams



Requirements


2+ years of related experience, ideally at a top-tier management consulting firm, investment bank, or in a strategy & planning role at a major corporation
Excellent analytical skills including familiarity with SQL
Interest and/or experience in Motors a plus, but not required
Knowledge of ecommerce and market landscape



Please see the Talent Privacy Notice for information regarding how eBay handles your personal data collected when you use the eBay Careers website or apply for a job with eBay.

eBay is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you have a need that requires accommodation, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for accommodation as soon as possible. View our accessibility statement to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities.

Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes: HI, NM)" excludes residents of Hawaii and New Mexico.

This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.

Title: Data Analyst - Alteryx + 10% bonus
Description:
#Salary on this role is tax free#




Overview

Our client is an established, international bank that is involved in progressive policy reform and investment, across multiple continents. They have over 4000 employees globally and are now looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their team on a 3-year FTC basis, providing support internally on Alteryx and solution design for businesses.




Main Responsibilities

◾ Provide support in the use and development of solutions using Alteryx and Tableau internally.

◾ Advocate a consistent analysis, design, development and delivery of data solutions using recognized processes and techniques.

◾ Educate end-users in data solutions by proactively engaging with product owners, internal and external stakeholders.

◾ Create documents and workshops to educate users on data solutions.

◾ Document requests, test plans and solution designs.




Skills and Experience

◾ Extensive experience of development in Alteryx and Tableau.

◾ Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role

◾ Experience in the creation of dataflows, extracts, views, workbooks, deployments, schedules.

◾ Working knowledge of SQL (Oracle/SQL Server), data modelling concepts and standards.

◾ Familiarity with ETL processes and data warehousing principles.

◾ Strong team player with ability to work in a cross-functional team, following Agile principles.

◾ Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

◾ Experience in organising workshops and trainings is desirable.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data & BI

Location: Head Office

Description

In 2024 we're transforming Pasta Evangelists into a truly data-driven organisation.

In a fast-paced industry, a 'Best In Class' BI team will be crucial if we are to grow as quickly in the next 3 years, as we have in the previous 3.

Having invested heavily in consolidating data across all aspects of our business and rebuilt our Power BI reporting suite for all verticals(Takeaway, E-Commerce, and e-retail), we now have a strong foundation to surface the insights to drive growth.

What you'll do at Pasta Evangelists:


Integrate with our new ERP system and build the data pipelines needed to automate P&L reporting.
Own and optimise our Takeaway PPC and Marketing Offer strategy to grow order volume.
Enhance our modelling to identify the optimal locations for additional restaurants across the UK.
Evolve the models to improve the accuracy of order forecasting across the business.
Support Finance and Commercial with pricing and basket value optimization.
Grow our data-driven culture and coach stakeholders on how to surface the insights they need to drive day-to-day operations.
Analyse customer feedback on our products and recommend changes to our Food NPD team.
Continue to develop clear, concise, and insightful reporting and data models that will allow our stakeholders to self-serve.
For a candidate to succeed in this role, they must be able to produce insights, in addition to building the dashboards.
Support the design and development of new data warehousing.
Collaborate with co-workers and management to implement operational improvements.


Who you are:


Computer Science, Finance, Business graduate or similar.
Highly competent with Power BI and DAX
Strong SQL and Excel
Clear communication and attention to detail is crucial
Ability to multi-task and to coordinate a series of different jobs concurrently
Can articulate insights from a complex solution, simply and coherently.
You love working in a start-up team!
... A pasta lover!


What we can offer:


Competitive salary to attract the best talent
Join a dynamic, fast-moving & diverse team
Regular team socials and pasta tastings, as well as occasional trips to 'il bel paese'
Free Pasta Evangelists products
Cycle to work scheme
25 days of paid annual leave (plus bank holidays)
Show more

  • Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
  • Data Analyst - £50,000
  • Business Data Analyst - £67,500
  • Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
  • Business Analysts - £60,000

Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.

  • Microsoft excel - to expert level.
  • Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
  • Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
  • Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.

Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: London, SE1

The ideal candidate will have active SC Clearance or be eligible to undergo SC Clearance.




The Role




Experis Academy are seeking a Data Analyst working for a global organisation on a full-time, initially on a temporary ongoing basis.




People have multiple identities within the data platform. These identities are asserted at various points during the processes and are all associated to an owning person. Applications will then use these identities and the associated biographics as part of their processing.




We experience a 'Merged Identity' issue when the identities for more than one individual are linked together. This then leads to the data from separate individuals displaying under one profile. There are numerous reasons this can arise.




To fix such issues, the current IBM Level 2 team apply a data fix to resolve the underlying issue and split the individuals apart. This is done with direction from which identity belongs to which individual. Identity Operations (IDOps) are currently the client-side team responsible with providing this direction before a final approval is provided by the Common Services Data Platform (CSDP) approval prior to actioning.




Essential skills required




A minimum of 18 months experience in a Data Analyst role.
Excellent problem solving, teamwork skills and collaborative skills.
An eagerness to learn.
Interest in developing and delivering leading edge technologies.
Ability to work in high-pressure scenarios.
Understanding of data tools such as; Postman, graph visualisation software.




Additional skills that are beneficial




An understanding of Business processes around enrolments and immigration history would be a big bonus.
Experience using any of the following: Jira, Confluence, Service Now, Zabbix and Dynatrace, Graph UI, Kubernetes and Docker, Amazon Web Services, Linux, LDAP

Benefits

Competitive salary depending on experience
Hands on experience within a global organisation
Contributory pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program
Medical and Dental cover
22 days holiday + bank holidays
Maternity Pay/Shared Parental leave and paternity leave
Sick pay




Interested candidates should apply in the first instance.

Title: Data Analyst - Risk
Description:
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our clients Risk Models and Data team within the 2nd Line of Defence (2LOD). This is an exciting opportunity to support key data analysis and governance initiatives while contributing to the wider risk management function.




Key Responsibilities:

Run regular production of Management Information (MI) reports and handle ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Assist in the development of both ad-hoc and regular management reporting through robust data analysis.
Enhance the efficiency of MI production processes.
Support data quality resolution and data lineage activities within the team.
Contribute to building a strong data governance and data quality framework within the risk function.
Ensure compliance with the bank's Risk Management framework and escalate concerns when necessary.




What We’re Looking For:

Minimum 1 year of experience working with data analysis in financial services.
Degree educated (or equivalent), preferably in a STEM subject.
Intermediate knowledge of SAS and SQL, with a passion for further development.
Understanding of risk/financial terminology with a desire to expand this knowledge.
Proficient in MS Excel, including formulas and pivot tables; knowledge of Power BI is a plus.
Strong attention to detail and a proactive, collaborative approach.




**unfortunately, no sponsorship is available for this position**

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Pensions - £465 Per Day (Inside IR35) – 6 Month Contract – Hybrid




Overview:

An excellent opportunity has become available with our client, a global financial services firm who are currently undergoing an exciting transformation. We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to offer expertise in data services (including data, interfaces, and report analysis) and to support both client implementations and the day-to-day operations of systems for internal and external clients.




The ideal candidate must have a minimum of 2 years of experience in administering or programming pension calculations.




Role & Responsibilities:

Contribute to the improvement and standardisation of processes, tools, and documentation for all deliverables related to "Data."
Actively share knowledge to reduce key main risks across Implementations and wider teams to enable self-service with their pension administration product.
Collaborate with the core product and development teams to identify and help with delivering cross-departmental improvements for pension administrations products.
Collaborate with your team leader to ensure that all implementation services meet the required quality standards and are delivered on time and within budget.
Understand, analyse, and document business requirements; develop working processes based on these requirements, considering existing and potential new systems.
Analyse, document, and adhere to Business Requirement Specifications standards.
Stay informed about changes in pension legislation that could impact the functionality of our products, systems, processes, and procedures.
Identify and recommend areas for improvement in existing systems, processes, and procedures to enhance efficiency and productivity.
Detect problems or shortcomings in documentation, propose, and implement solutions.
Accurately track working hours using Jira and the Time Recording Engine.
Assist business users throughout their User Acceptance Testing (UAT) cycle.
Actively participate in team and departmental meetings, as well as technical forums.




Essential Skills & Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience in administering or programming pension calculations.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to work effectively within set frameworks and deadlines.
Must be highly numerate, methodical, and logical, with excellent problem-solving abilities and a keen eye for detail.
A strong commitment to and enthusiasm for delivering high-quality work within established guidelines.
Solid technical knowledge of pensions and relevant legislation.
Experience with pensions administration software.
Proactively keeps up-to-date with developments and trends in the programming community.




Contract Details:

Day rate: £425 - £465 per day
IR35 status: Inside IR35 via Umbrella

HTML:
Data Analyst – Pensions - £465 Per Day (Inside IR35) – 6 Month Contract – Hybrid


Overview:

An excellent opportunity has become available with our client, a global financial services firm who are currently undergoing an exciting transformation. We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to offer expertise in data services (including data, interfaces, and report analysis) and to support both client implementations and the day-to-day operations of systems for internal and external clients.


The ideal candidate must have a minimum of 2 years of experience in administering or programming pension calculations.


Role & Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to the improvement and standardisation of processes, tools, and documentation for all deliverables related to "Data."
  • Actively share knowledge to reduce key main risks across Implementations and wider teams to enable self-service with their pension administration product.
  • Collaborate with the core product and development teams to identify and help with delivering cross-departmental improvements for pension administrations products.
  • Collaborate with your team leader to ensure that all implementation services meet the required quality standards and are delivered on time and within budget.
  • Understand, analyse, and document business requirements; develop working processes based on these requirements, considering existing and potential new systems.
  • Analyse, document, and adhere to Business Requirement Specifications standards.
  • Stay informed about changes in pension legislation that could impact the functionality of our products, systems, processes, and procedures.
  • Identify and recommend areas for improvement in existing systems, processes, and procedures to enhance efficiency and productivity.
  • Detect problems or shortcomings in documentation, propose, and implement solutions.
  • Accurately track working hours using Jira and the Time Recording Engine.
  • Assist business users throughout their User Acceptance Testing (UAT) cycle.
  • Actively participate in team and departmental meetings, as well as technical forums.


Essential Skills & Requirements:

  • At least 2 years of experience in administering or programming pension calculations.
  • Strong analytical skills and the ability to work effectively within set frameworks and deadlines.
  • Must be highly numerate, methodical, and logical, with excellent problem-solving abilities and a keen eye for detail.
  • A strong commitment to and enthusiasm for delivering high-quality work within established guidelines.
  • Solid technical knowledge of pensions and relevant legislation.
  • Experience with pensions administration software.
  • Proactively keeps up-to-date with developments and trends in the programming community.


Contract Details:

  • Day rate: £425 - £465 per day
  • IR35 status: Inside IR35 via Umbrella
  • Contract length: 6 months
  • Location: Hybrid / London (other locations across the UK available also) (2X per week)

Title: Data Analyst London (Entry Level)
Description:
Are you looking to kickstart your career in data?

Join iO-Sphere's unique training programme - the Data Analyst Experience Accelerator - it is designed to secure individuals their next career step and become a data analyst.

Apply now to join our upcoming cohorts starting on October 7th or November 18th: https://io-sphere.io/data-analytics

How does it work?


We work with our network of employers to understand their data talent needs. They are often looking for data analysts, senior analysts, data scientists, analytics engineers and effective managers
We recruit and train talented individuals over the course of 10 weeks to get them ready for the jobs with our employers
We match and connect our best students with our employers
Joining iO-Sphere means becoming part of the community for life. We continue to support our community with ongoing mentoring and training throughout their career


Ready to apply? It only takes a minute: https://io-sphere.io/data-analytics

The Roles

We work with many different organisations seeking to hire talented data analysts. The majority of these roles will require you to:


Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using technical tools like Excel, SQL, Power BI, Big Query and Python
Create dashboards, presentations, and recommendations to help solve complex business problems
Work with management to prioritise business and information needs
Generate strong insights about the business to be able to improve performance


Ideal Candidates


Highly numerate & analytical thinker
Curious problem solver
Humble and willing to learn
The ability to commit to full time for 10 weeks
Fluent in written and spoken English


What To Expect On The Experience Accelerator


The Experience Accelerator is a flexible 10-week programme to give talented data professionals the technical skills and experience to take their career to the next level. By the end, you will be an effective data analyst with the toolkit to land the job you want
The first 5 weeks are full-time and fully remote
The final 5 weeks are full-time and in-person

We strongly encourage applications from women, people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and non-binary individuals, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Data Insights, Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Visualization, Stakeholder Engagement, Reporting & Analysis, Social Media Analytics, Market Research, Data Management, Power BI, Tableau – London – Hybrid - £55,000 - £65,000




An innovative and leading organization in the entertainment sector is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Data Insights team in London. This permanent position offers a hybrid working arrangement, combining office and remote work. The role focuses on delivering advanced data solutions and strategic analysis to enhance opportunities for clients across various entertainment sectors.




This role is to be performed on a Hybrid basis and will require 2/3 days per week onsite in West London.




Key Skills & Experience:




Education: Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field, or equivalent specialized training/certification is preferred.
Experience: Minimum of four years in an Analyst role or a similar position within an entertainment agency, consumer brand, market research firm, advertising agency, or related company.
Communication Skills: Excellent interpersonal and written communication abilities; highly collaborative and inclusive team player, with a proactive and self-starting approach.
Organizational Skills: Highly detail-oriented and well-organized; capable of managing multiple tasks and deadlines in a fast-paced environment and adapting to changes effectively.
Industry Knowledge: Strong passion for and understanding of cultural and industry trends affecting brands and consumers, with a preference for experience in the live entertainment sector (music, comedy, and sports).
Digital Literacy: Knowledge of the entertainment, social media, and digital landscapes, including consumer and platform trends, audience measurement, metrics, and monetization strategies.
Data Analytics Experience: Proficient in mining and analyzing data from social listening, digital analytics, and market research tools (e.g., Meltwater, NetBase, Helixa, Nielsen, MRI/Simmons, Google Analytics, E-Poll).
Social Media Fluency: Avid user with fluency in social media platforms (e.g., Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, Twitter, Facebook).
Technical Skills: Experienced in Microsoft Excel and creating client-facing PowerPoint presentations; experience with modern Data Visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) is preferred.
Data-Driven Problem Solving: Skilled in using data to address business challenges and generate actionable insights for users.
Data Education: Committed to educating stakeholders, sharing information, and empowering through data.




Main Responsibilities:




Data Analysis: Derive actionable insights from various data sources, focusing on Music, Comedy, and Sports sectors to support decision-making and strategy development.
Stakeholder Liaison: Act as a key point of contact between data teams and business stakeholders to gather, clarify, and organize requirements for data solutions.
Reporting & Visualization: Create and present clear, visually intuitive reports and dashboards to communicate findings effectively to internal and external stakeholders.
Tool Utilization: Leverage proprietary and third-party analytics tools to evaluate and showcase the impact, popularity, and value of clients' projects and initiatives.Data Management: Manage relationships with data vendors and ensure the accuracy, completeness, and relevance of data used for analysis.
Training & Support: Conduct training sessions for internal stakeholders on analytics platforms, maintain relevant documentation, and promote effective use of data products.
Project Coordination: Oversee multiple projects across different departments, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.
Trend Analysis: Analyze and interpret industry trends, social media metrics, and consumer behavior to identify opportunities and inform strategic planning.
Data Education: Promote data literacy and understanding within the organization by sharing insights and educating stakeholders on best practices and data-driven decision-making.
Communication: Maintain open communication channels with team members and stakeholders, adapting to feedback and evolving project requirements.




Location: UK Hybrid/ London




Candidates must be eligible to work in this country.




Catch Resource Management is a leading provider of Dynamics AX, JD Edwards, NetSuite and other ERP resources to both end users and to product suppliers/authors.




Our consultants deliver a completely professional resourcing service, always backed up by our team of ERP specialists who are all experienced in full project life cycle implementation and support, thus ensuring that we fully understand our clients’ requirements and our candidates’ skills.




If you have the relevant skills and experience for this position we would welcome your application, however please note that we receive high levels of responses to our advertisements so can only immediately respond to those that are a close match. However, if you are interested in hearing about similar positions then please register on our website: www.catchgroup.com.

Data Visualisation Analyst

Company & Role Overview:

My client is a leading consulting firm, they combine sector expertise with a boutique approach to their clients. They offer endless opportunity for personal development and pride themselves on fostering an inclusive culture. You will be working in the data visualisation team and will be servicing both internal and external projects. This is a permanent role and is based in London. Experience with Python.

Title: Business/Data Analyst (£50-60k)
Description:
The Highlights!

We’re thrilled to be working with this impressive fintech business, based in Central London, focused on delivering insight products and services to the finance sector. After receiving significant investment, they are growing their data management function as they look to realise their ambition of building a market leading platform.

This Business Data Analyst position is part of a growing delivery team that owns the development and improvement of core data workflows. Working in a matrix environment with talented teams in Data, Technology and Product, you’ll act as the connection point between end users and the data team, building an understanding of the as is and to be business processes.

A fantastic opportunity for someone to further develop their analysis skills, this role would suit someone moving from a data operations position or someone that has already established themselves as a Business/Data Analyst.

Our client’s working arrangements require three days per week in the office in London as a minimum. This is a deliberate and thoughtful choice that is aligned with an emphasis on collaboration between the product and data teams and the user community.

About The Company

This Fintech business has demonstrated an admirable track record of adapting to meet the needs of its customers, evolving its product portfolio and establishing itself as one of the leaders in the provision of insight products and services to the financial sector.

Through adopting a customer centric approach they have been able to demonstrate impressive growth domestically and internationally. It is the breadth of services, combined with investment in technology, and crucially the people that deliver it, that has seen the business go from strength to strength.

About The Opportunity

Working directly for the Head of Data, in a team that is set to grow significantly over coming months, your key focus will be on supporting the backlog of data management tasks undertaken by the Product Owners.

Using your eye for detail you’ll create accurate documentation that details the current state of core data systems, applications and workflows before working with Product Owners and stakeholders to document the target state.

You’ll use your inquisitive nature to ask questions of your users, helping you to understand the business needs that would drive new developments and enhancements to the core systems. Drafting requirements and preparing user stories, you’ll be building on the core skills that could ultimately support a move into product management.

An agile environment, this role will have you playing an active part in Scrum ceremonies, backlog refinement and preparation sessions. You’ll also use your data analysis skills to support decision making on what tasks to prioritise and why.

Bringing a quality focus to this position you’ll be involved in the testing process, from planning and executing User Acceptance Test scenarios and scripts as required.

Acting as the bridge between stakeholders and the engineering team, you’ll ensure that requirements are understood and met throughout the development process.

About You

A strong Data or Business Analyst, you’ll evidence the ability to blend core business analysis skills with an excellent grasp of data management and processing, using these skills to improve data workflows across the business.

In Addition, You’ll Demonstrate The Following


Experience working either in a data product business or in a data team that has been responsible for working with large scale data challenges. Time spent working in a Fintech environment is particularly helpful but not essential.
Ability to create data documents and artefacts.
Experience of working in an Agile environment and in partnership with Product Owners.
Strong data analysis skills using tools such as SQL and Power BI.
Exceptional communication skills that support your engagement with team members and stakeholders.
Confidence in visualising data and communicating your analysis of that data.


Inclusion Statement

We are dedicated to providing reasonable adjustments to applicants throughout the recruitment process and we work closely with our clients to encourage them to do the same.

If you require any accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know. Your needs will be treated confidentially and with respect.

We strive to eliminate biases and create an environment where all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, qualifications, and potential contributions.

If you have any feedback on how we can improve our process in any way, please don't hesitate to reach out.

This Business Data Analyst position is part of a growing delivery team that owns the development and improvement of core data workflows. Working in a matrix environment with talented teams in Data, Technology and Product, you’ll act as the connection point between end users and the data team, building an understanding of the as is and to be business processes.

A fantastic opportunity for someone to further develop their analysis skills, this role would suit someone moving from a data operations position or someone that has already established themselves as a Business/Data Analyst.

Our client’s working arrangements require three days per week in the office in London as a minimum. This is a deliberate and thoughtful choice that is aligned with an emphasis on collaboration between the product and data teams and the user community.

About The Company

This Fintech business has demonstrated an admirable track record of adapting to meet the needs of its customers, evolving its product portfolio and establishing itself as one of the leaders in the provision of insight products and services to the financial sector.

Through adopting a customer centric approach they have been able to demonstrate impressive growth domestically and internationally. It is the breadth of services, combined with investment in technology, and crucially the people that deliver it, that has seen the business go from strength to strength.

About The Opportunity

Working directly for the Head of Data, in a team that is set to grow significantly over coming months, your key focus will be on supporting the backlog of data management tasks undertaken by the Product Owners.

Using your eye for detail you’ll create accurate documentation that details the current state of core data systems, applications and workflows before working with Product Owners and stakeholders to document the target state.

You’ll use your inquisitive nature to ask questions of your users, helping you to understand the business needs that would drive new developments and enhancements to the core systems. Drafting requirements and preparing user stories, you’ll be building on the core skills that could ultimately support a move into product management.

An agile environment, this role will have you playing an active part in Scrum ceremonies, backlog refinement and preparation sessions. You’ll also use your data analysis skills to support decision making on what tasks to prioritise and why.

Bringing a quality focus to this position you’ll be involved in the testing process, from planning and executing User Acceptance Test scenarios and scripts as required.

Acting as the bridge between stakeholders and the engineering team, you’ll ensure that requirements are understood and met throughout the development process.

About You

A strong Data or Business Analyst, you’ll evidence the ability to blend core business analysis skills with an excellent grasp of data management and processing, using these skills to improve data workflows across the business.

In Addition, You’ll Demonstrate The Following

  • Experience working either in a data product business or in a data team that has been responsible for working with large scale data challenges. Time spent working in a Fintech environment is particularly helpful but not essential.
  • Ability to create data documents and artefacts.
  • Experience of working in an Agile environment and in partnership with Product Owners.
  • Strong data analysis skills using tools such as SQL and Power BI.
  • Exceptional communication skills that support your engagement with team members and stakeholders.
  • Confidence in visualising data and communicating your analysis of that data.

Inclusion Statement

We are dedicated to providing reasonable adjustments to applicants throughout the recruitment process and we work closely with our clients to encourage them to do the same.

If you require any accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let us know. Your needs will be treated confidentially and with respect.

We strive to eliminate biases and create an environment where all candidates are evaluated based on their skills, qualifications, and potential contributions.

If you have any feedback on how we can improve our process in any way, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Title: Data Analyst & BI - Remote UK
Description:
The Wise Seeker is the leading HR technology company in unbiased talent evaluation.With over 15 years in the industry analyzing the needs and demands of the job market, we are capable of identifying the best talent for each company thanks to our team of professionals and our SaaS platform integrated with Artificial Intelligence.We are efficient, evaluate talent objectively without bias, and close hiring times in record time, delivering optimal results.

As a Data Analyst & BI Specialist, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and developing BI solutions to support strategic decision-making. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and deliver data-driven insights.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to identify trends and patterns.
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data models and visualizations.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business initiatives and decision-making.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide insights to improve business processes.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all reports and dashboards.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and BI.


Benefits


Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work culture.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST – ACQUISITION & ENGAGEMENT

£44,000 - £54,000

HYBRID – LONDON – 2-3X A WEEK




*Please note, this company is unable to offer sponsorship at this time and you must be a UK resident*




THE COMPANY

This credit score and report service have 22 million users globally, with offices around the world including Cape Town, Sydney, Toronto and more! They’re now looking to add to their London office.




THE ROLE

You'll be looking after the business’ core product, finding out ways to monetise its customers but also attract non-paying customers. You’ll be getting stuck in with a tonne of customer data, allowing you to leverage Machine Learning models and personalising the experience.




SKILLS + EXPERIENCE

Strong SQL
Visualisation tools – open to any e.g. Power BI, Tableau, Looker etc
User acquisition experience a must
Engagement/personalisation analytics via CRM experience




HOW TO APPLY

If this sounds like the role for you, swiftly send over your CV to Izzi at Harnham by using the link below.




KEY TERMS

IBM, Coremetrics, Google Analytics, GA, Omniture, SiteCatalyst, Adobe Analytics, Analyst, Web, Digital, Online, Website, Financial Services, Finance, A/B, Test, Split, Multivariate, MVT, Tracking, Code, Tagging, Tags, Insight, Client, Agency, Management, Strategy, CRO, Conversion, Optimisation, Optimizely, Test and Target, Adobe Target, Maxymiser, VWO, Visual Website Optimiser, Tag Manager, Tag-manager, Tagging, Tag Management, Set Up Tags, Manage Tags, Manage Tagging, Managing Tags, Managing Tagging, Setting Up Tags, Analytics Tracking, Implement Tags, Implement Tagging, Tagging Implementation, Tag Implementation, Tracking Implementation, Analytics Implementation

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Data Insight (London)
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be working within the London Data Insight team, supporting the business in their use of RBC BlueBay's self-service applications and tools. The team works with different areas of the business to make sure these applications and tools are being used correctly, efficiently, and solving the right business problems.

You will interact with most areas of the business, getting exposure to multiple teams and learning different aspects of a fixed-income focused asset manager. You’ll also get the opportunity to work with different technologies like Python and Tableau.

What will you do?


Deliver, on a timely basis, high-quality PI (Portfolio Insight) dashboards for users throughout the firm, built using best practice principals and developed within the agreed boundaries of the PI governance framework.


PI is an internally developed application providing reporting on BlueBay’s Data Warehouse.


Help users with complicated PI questions.
Create and apply best practices for PI in BlueBay, including optimising dashboard productivity, prioritising business demand, and where possible, achieving high levels of reuse with existing dashboards and business logic.
Organise training for colleagues, building up the knowledge across the firm to support the ultimate end objective of self-servicing.
Work closely with PI developers to improve the user experience.
Create new processes and automate existing manual processes in Python, and review Python development by business users as part of the EUSE (End User Software Engineering) process.
Writing database queries, including metadata queries against PI, and historical data requests against BlueBay’s legacy databases.
Establish best practices for Tableau and help ensure they are followed. Act as the business owner for the Tableau environment.
Deliver, on a timely basis, high-quality Tableau dashboards for users throughout the firm, built using best practice principals and developed within the agreed boundaries of the Tableau governance framework.
Help users with complicated Tableau questions.
Align work with good data governance practice in accordance with the RBC Enterprise Policy (EDP).


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have


Fixed Income business knowledge, especially Fund and Benchmark position reporting.


Exposure to or interest in the following technologies:


Data Reporting and Data Visualisation (Tableau).
SQL querying (SQL Server).
Python scripting.
Positive and energetic.
Demonstrates excellent attention to detail.
Prioritises solving business problems rather than worrying about specific responsibilities with the role.
Always looking to learn and increase scope of responsibilities.
Able to manage own workload, escalating to management when needed.
Able to deal with ambiguity in client requirements and make decisive decisions.
Thinks about improvements to existing processes/tasks, doesn’t just react to work coming into the team.


Nice-to-have


Experience in a buy-side business reporting or support type role, with a focus on fixed income, either directly for an asset manager (or similar) or through a software vendor.
This is a technical role, but for the level being hired exposure to business concepts is just as important as technical skills, though the candidate must be technically-minded and have an interest in the technologies used in the role.


What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation

HTML:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

You will be working within the London Data Insight team, supporting the business in their use of RBC BlueBay's self-service applications and tools. The team works with different areas of the business to make sure these applications and tools are being used correctly, efficiently, and solving the right business problems.

You will interact with most areas of the business, getting exposure to multiple teams and learning different aspects of a fixed-income focused asset manager. You’ll also get the opportunity to work with different technologies like Python and Tableau.

What will you do?

  • Deliver, on a timely basis, high-quality PI (Portfolio Insight) dashboards for users throughout the firm, built using best practice principals and developed within the agreed boundaries of the PI governance framework.

PI is an internally developed application providing reporting on BlueBay’s Data Warehouse.

  • Help users with complicated PI questions.
  • Create and apply best practices for PI in BlueBay, including optimising dashboard productivity, prioritising business demand, and where possible, achieving high levels of reuse with existing dashboards and business logic.
  • Organise training for colleagues, building up the knowledge across the firm to support the ultimate end objective of self-servicing.
  • Work closely with PI developers to improve the user experience.
  • Create new processes and automate existing manual processes in Python, and review Python development by business users as part of the EUSE (End User Software Engineering) process.
  • Writing database queries, including metadata queries against PI, and historical data requests against BlueBay’s legacy databases.
  • Establish best practices for Tableau and help ensure they are followed. Act as the business owner for the Tableau environment.
  • Deliver, on a timely basis, high-quality Tableau dashboards for users throughout the firm, built using best practice principals and developed within the agreed boundaries of the Tableau governance framework.
  • Help users with complicated Tableau questions.
  • Align work with good data governance practice in accordance with the RBC Enterprise Policy (EDP).

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Fixed Income business knowledge, especially Fund and Benchmark position reporting.

Exposure to or interest in the following technologies:

  • Data Reporting and Data Visualisation (Tableau).
  • SQL querying (SQL Server).
  • Python scripting.
  • Positive and energetic.
  • Demonstrates excellent attention to detail.
  • Prioritises solving business problems rather than worrying about specific responsibilities with the role.
  • Always looking to learn and increase scope of responsibilities.
  • Able to manage own workload, escalating to management when needed.
  • Able to deal with ambiguity in client requirements and make decisive decisions.
  • Thinks about improvements to existing processes/tasks, doesn’t just react to work coming into the team.

Nice-to-have

  • Experience in a buy-side business reporting or support type role, with a focus on fixed income, either directly for an asset manager (or similar) or through a software vendor.
  • This is a technical role, but for the level being hired exposure to business concepts is just as important as technical skills, though the candidate must be technically-minded and have an interest in the technologies used in the role.

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

Job Skills

Critical Thinking, Data Administration, Database Structures, Data Modeling, Data Movement, Detail-Oriented, Group Problem Solving, Information Capture, Standard Operating Procedure (SOP), Teamwork
